page.title: 12STOTTESDON PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: Stottesdon & Sidbury Parish Council has 10 members (3 women). It meets in the school when the need arises, usually 8 times a year.{Planning {applications}received through the District Council are discussed, & recommendations made. Members also bring{local concerns}(usually about roads & ditches, or illegally parked caravans) to the meeting, & seek action from the County Council. The council also seeks to encourage{local {initiatives,}and improve{amenities. Grants are occasionally made to support{local groups}& also for the maintainance of burial grounds. The {main concern}at the moment is to arrest the decline in the community by preventing the school's closure, supporting a new surgery, & promoting the building of small homes, while conserving our heritage.
